chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Your Response:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

Your Response:
```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
None

Goal:
forall (X Y : Type) (f : X -> Y), surjective f -> le_cardinal (cardinality Y) (cardinality X)

Premises:
Inductive GFormula (TA TX AA AF : Type) : Type := TT : Tauto.GFormula | FF : Tauto.GFormula | X : TX -> Tauto.GFormula | A : TA -> AA -> Tauto.GFormula | Cj : Tauto.GFormula -> Tauto.GFormula -> Tauto.GFormula | D : Tauto.GFormula -> Tauto.GFormula -> Tauto.GFormula | N : Tauto.GFormula -> Tauto.GFormula | I : Tauto.GFormula -> option AF -> Tauto.GFormula -> Tauto.GFormula Arguments Tauto.GFormula {TA TX AA AF}%type_scope Arguments Tauto.TT {TA TX AA AF}%type_scope Arguments Tauto.FF {TA TX AA AF}%type_scope Arguments Tauto.X {TA TX AA AF}%type_scope Arguments Tauto.A {TA TX AA AF}%type_scope Arguments Tauto.Cj {TA TX AA AF}%type_scope Arguments Tauto.D {TA TX AA AF}%
surjective = fun (X Y : Type) (f : X -> Y) => forall y : Y, exists x : X, f x = y : forall X Y : Type, (X -> Y) -> Prop Arguments surjective {X Y}%type_scope _%function_scope
Inductive le_cardinal : Cardinal -> Cardinal -> Prop := inj_le_cardinal : forall (X Y : Type) (f : X -> Y), injective f -> le_cardinal (cardinality X) (cardinality Y) Arguments inj_le_cardinal {X Y}%type_scope _%function_scope
Inductive Cardinal : Type := cardinality : Type -> Cardinal Arguments cardinality _%type_scope
Inductive eq_cardinal : Cardinal -> Cardinal -> Prop := bij_eq_cardinal : forall (X Y : Type) (f : X -> Y), bijective f -> eq_cardinal (cardinality X) (cardinality Y) Arguments bij_eq_cardinal {X Y}%type_scope _%function_scope
le_cardinal_ind : forall P : Cardinal -> Cardinal -> Prop, (forall (X Y : Type) (f : X -> Y), injective f -> P (cardinality X) (cardinality Y)) -> forall c c0 : Cardinal, le_cardinal c c0 -> P c c0
le_cardinal_sind : forall P : Cardinal -> Cardinal -> SProp, (forall (X Y : Type) (f : X -> Y), injective f -> P (cardinality X) (cardinality Y)) -> forall c c0 : Cardinal, le_cardinal c c0 -> P c c0
eq_cardinal_ind : forall P : Cardinal -> Cardinal -> Prop, (forall (X Y : Type) (f : X -> Y), bijective f -> P (cardinality X) (cardinality Y)) -> forall c c0 : Cardinal, eq_cardinal c c0 -> P c c0
eq_cardinal_sind : forall P : Cardinal -> Cardinal -> SProp, (forall (X Y : Type) (f : X -> Y), bijective f -> P (cardinality X) (cardinality Y)) -> forall c c0 : Cardinal, eq_cardinal c c0 -> P c c0
bijective = fun (X Y : Type) (f : X -> Y) => injective f /\ surjective f : forall X Y : Type, (X -> Y) -> Prop Arguments bijective {X Y}%type_scope _%function_scope
CSB : forall (X Y : Type) (f : X -> Y) (g : Y -> X), injective f -> injective g -> exists h : X -> Y, bijective h
cantor_diag : forall (X : Type) (f : X -> X -> bool), ~ surjective f
cantor_diag2 : forall (X : Type) (f : X -> X -> Prop), ~ surjective f
le_cardinal_preorder = {| preord_refl := fun x : Cardinal => eq_cardinal_impl_le_cardinal x x (equiv_refl eq_cardinal_equiv x); preord_trans := fun (x y z : Cardinal) (H : le_cardinal x y) (H0 : le_cardinal y z) => match H in (le_cardinal c c0) return (le_cardinal c0 z -> le_cardinal c z) with | @inj_le_cardinal X Y f H1 => fun H2 : le_cardinal (cardinality Y) z => let H3 : cardinality Y = cardinality Y -> z = z -> le_cardinal (cardinality X) z := match H2 in (le_cardinal c c0) return (c = cardinality Y -> c0 = z -> le_cardinal (cardinality X) z) with | @inj_le_cardinal X0 Y0 f0 H3 => fun (H4 : cardinality X0 = cardinality Y) (H...
inj_le_cardinal : forall f : ?X -> ?Y, injective f -> le_cardinal (cardinality ?X) (cardinality ?Y) where ?X : [ |- Type] ?Y : [ |- Type]
incl_soustr : forall (U : Type) (X Y : Ensemble U) (x : U), Included X Y -> Included (Subtract X x) (Subtract Y x)
eq_cardinal_equiv = {| equiv_refl := fun x : Cardinal => match x as c return (eq_cardinal c c) with | cardinality T => bij_eq_cardinal (fun x0 : T => x0) (conj (fun (x0 y : T) (H : x0 = y) => H) (fun y : T => ex_intro (fun x0 : T => x0 = y) y eq_refl)) end; equiv_trans := fun (x y z : Cardinal) (H : eq_cardinal x y) (H0 : eq_cardinal y z) => match H in (eq_cardinal c c0) return (eq_cardinal c0 z -> eq_cardinal c z) with | @bij_eq_cardinal X Y f H1 => fun H2 : eq_cardinal (cardinality Y) z => let H3 : cardinality Y = cardinality Y -> z = z -> eq_cardinal (cardinality X) z := match H2 in (eq_cardinal c c...
bij_eq_cardinal : forall f : ?X -> ?Y, bijective f -> eq_cardinal (cardinality ?X) (cardinality ?Y) where ?X : [ |- Type] ?Y : [ |- Type]
injective = fun (U V : Type) (f : U -> V) => forall x y : U, f x = f y -> x = y : forall U V : Type, (U -> V) -> Prop Arguments injective {U V}%type_scope _%function_scope
Cardinal_rec : forall P : Cardinal -> Set, (forall T : Type, P (cardinality T)) -> forall c : Cardinal, P c
Cardinal_ind : forall P : Cardinal -> Prop, (forall T : Type, P (cardinality T)) -> forall c : Cardinal, P c
Cardinal_rect : forall P : Cardinal -> Type, (forall T : Type, P (cardinality T)) -> forall c : Cardinal, P c
Cardinal_sind : forall P : Cardinal -> SProp, (forall T : Type, P (cardinality T)) -> forall c : Cardinal, P c
Relations.inverse_image_of_equivalence : forall (A B : Type) (f : A -> B) (r : relation B), equivalence r -> equivalence (fun x y : A => r (f x) (f y))
le_cardinal_antisym : forall kappa lambda : Cardinal, le_cardinal kappa lambda -> le_cardinal lambda kappa -> eq_cardinal kappa lambda
ClassicalFacts.wproof_irrelevance_cc : forall (or : Prop -> Prop -> Prop) (or_introl : forall A B : Prop, A -> or A B) (or_intror : forall A B : Prop, B -> or A B) (or_elim : forall A B C : Prop, (A -> C) -> (B -> C) -> or A B -> C), (forall (A B C : Prop) (f : A -> C) (g : B -> C) (a : A), f a = or_elim A B C f g (or_introl A B a)) -> (forall (A B C : Prop) (f : A -> C) (g : B -> C) (b : B), g b = or_elim A B C f g (or_intror A B b)) ->...-> forall (B : Prop) (b1 b2 : B), ~ b1 <> b2
eq_cardinal_impl_le_cardinal : forall kappa lambda : Cardinal, eq_cardinal kappa lambda -> le_cardinal kappa lambda
BinNat.N.eqf = fun f g : BinNums.N -> bool => forall n : BinNums.N, f n = g n : (BinNums.N -> bool) -> (BinNums.N -> bool) -> Prop Arguments BinNat.N.eqf (_ _)%function_scope
ge_cardinal = fun kappa lambda : Cardinal => le_cardinal lambda kappa : Cardinal -> Cardinal -> Prop
ChoiceFacts.DependentFunctionalRelReification_on : forall A : Type, (A -> Type) -> Prop
lt_cardinal = fun kappa lambda : Cardinal => le_cardinal kappa lambda /\ ~ eq_cardinal kappa lambda : Cardinal -> Cardinal -> Prop
Ring_polynom.Peq_ok : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop), RelationClasses.Equivalence req -> Ring_theory.ring_eq_ext radd rmul ropp req -> forall (C : Type) (cO cI : C) (cadd cmul csub : C -> C -> C) (copp : C -> C) (ceqb : C -> C -> bool) (phi : C -> R), Ring_theory.ring_morph rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp req cO cI cadd cmul csub copp ceqb phi -> forall P P' : Ring_polynom.Pol C, Ring_polynom.Peq ceqb P P' = true -> Ring_polynom.Pequiv rO radd rmul req phi P P'
Ring_polynom.Peq_spec : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop), RelationClasses.Equivalence req -> Ring_theory.ring_eq_ext radd rmul ropp req -> forall (C : Type) (cO cI : C) (cadd cmul csub : C -> C -> C) (copp : C -> C) (ceqb : C -> C -> bool) (phi : C -> R), Ring_theory.ring_morph rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp req cO cI cadd cmul csub copp ceqb phi -> forall P P' : Ring_polynom.Pol C, BoolSpec (Ring_polynom.Pequiv rO radd rmul req phi P P') True (Ring_polynom.Peq ceqb P P')
RingMicromega.PaddC_ok : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (rplus rtimes rminus : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req rle rlt : R -> R -> Prop), OrderedRing.SOR rO rI rplus rtimes rminus ropp req rle rlt ->...-> forall (c : C) (P : EnvRing.Pol C) (env : RingMicromega.PolEnv R), req (RingMicromega.eval_pol rplus rtimes phi env (RingMicromega.paddC cplus P c)) (rplus (RingMicromega.eval_pol rplus rtimes phi env P) (phi c))

```coq
Lemma surjective_finite: forall (X Y : Type) (f : X -> Y), surjective f -> exists n : nat, forall x : X, exists y : Y, f y = x.
Proof.
  intros X Y f Hsurj.
  induction Hsurj as [|x0 y0].
  - exists 0. intros x. exists y0. auto.
  - intros n IHn.
    destruct IHn as [y Hf].
    exists (S n). intros x.
    destruct (Hsurj y0) as [x0 Hf0].
    exists x0. rewrite Hf0. auto.
Qed.
